document_title: Cyanotic congenital heart disease: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: benh-tim-bam-sinh-tim.json_0_What is cyanotic congenital heart disease?
subsection_content:
In children with congenital heart disease, one or more heart structures are abnormal (malformations). There are 2 groups of congenital heart diseases: (1)
Cyanotic congenital heart disease: This group includes heart defects that change the flow, causing oxygen-deprived blood to flow out to nourish the body. When a child is born with cyanotic congenital heart disease, the skin and mucous membranes often have a bluish color (due to insufficient oxygen in the blood), called cyanosis.; Non-cyanotic congenital heart disease: includes defects that do not affect the amount of oxygen supplied to the body.
